properties.Address: Sierra College Dr. and Litton Dr.
properties.Description: Artist: John Mowen

properties.Name: Mural
properties.Description: Artist:  Justin Lovato, partnered with The Chambers Project. 20 x 80 ft.

properties.Name: "New Dawn" Mural
properties.Description: Artist: Miles Toland. For Suicide awareness.

properties.Name: "The Curious Salmon Bike Rackдуќ
properties.Description: Made and installed by Curious Forge. Description: Custom built bike rack in the shape of 5 salmon arching out of the pavement. Evolution:  Amy and Chamba Cooke (owners's Summer Thyme's) approached Liam Ellerby at the Curious Forge with the idea of a bike rack as an art piece. The piece intends to raise awareness of the salmon in our watershed, foster bicycle use as green transportation, and encourage the enjoyment of art as practical and useful.

properties.Name: Metal Flower sculpture at Briar Patch
properties.Description: Artist: Sally Peterson

properties.Name: Metal Flower sculpture at As-If Studios
properties.Description: Artist: Sally Peterson

properties.Name: Miner statue -- Nevada Union High School
properties.Description: Miner statue.

properties.Name: Mining Artifact sculpture -- Nevada Union High School
properties.Description: Donated by Adelaide Tibessart  Plaque reads: "Pelton water wheel. Donated by Adelaide Tibessart in memory of her father, Thomas N. Coan, miner and pioneer of Indian Flat.

properties.Name: Stained Glass -- Lower waiting area lobby, Sierra Nevada Memorial Hospital
properties.Description: Artist: Pamela Mengers Hodges  In chapel which is off the hallway when you come into the main entrance.

properties.Name: Fountain sculpture at Pioneer Park
properties.Description: Design: Francis Lloyd, Sculptor: Norman Grag. The fountain was installed in 1976 with funds from the John J. Looser estate. The fountain was designed by architect Francis Lloyd and the metal sculpture was created by artist Norman Grag. The fountain was placed in the middle of an existing city street that ran through the park. The placement of the fountain resulted in an intentional redirection of the road.

properties.Name: Mural at Pioneer Park swimming pool
properties.Description: Artist: Jordan Mal did the project in 2016 as her Senior Project. Mural on the wall at the swimming pool -- serves as a painting and safety signage.  The wave on the wall matches the depth of the swimming pool, so if a child stands by the wall and the wave is over their head, they know that if they walk straight from that spot into the poolду_the water will be over their head.

properties.Name: Robinson Plaza -- Mining sculptures: Pelton Water Wheel and Five Stamp Mill
properties.Description: Pelton Water Wheel: Gift from PGE and Nevada City, dedicated Sept 17 1987. Pelton Water Wheel was in continuous use at PGE Drum Power House No. 4 from 1928-1987. 12 ft diameter, 15 tons.  Five-Stamp Mill: (1893) used to crush gold ore at Fortuna Mine near Nevada City. Donated to Nevada City by Bill Magers. Dedicated July 4, 1982

properties.Name: Robinson Plaza -- Metal sculpture
properties.Description: Artist:  Miriam Morris. Sculpture designed to block electrical boxes.

properties.Name: Calanan Park -- Metal sculpture
properties.Description: Artist:  Miriam Morris. Like Robinson Plaza, a metal sculpture designed to block electrical box.

properties.Name: Calanan Park -- old mining core, hydro monitor
properties.Description: Shaft Drill Core Monitor

properties.Name: Chinese Monument
properties.Description: The  Chinese Monument consists of a large rock, babbling fountain and dual plaques in English and old Chinese characters, all surrounded by natural landscaping.

properties.Name: "Ma Trux" Mural at Mother Truckers
properties.Description: Artist:   David Randolf Griffis.  David says "I painted the ma trux mural 16 years ago for a roast beef sandwich."  Mother Trucker's is like "the town square of the ridge."

properties.Name: Murals: Grizzly Hills School
properties.Description: Murals: (1) ceramic birds of the ridge  (2) Gary Snyder quote

properties.Name: North San Juan Post Office Mural
properties.Description: Artist: Andrea Eiermann.

properties.Name: "The Eyes of North San Juan"  Community Center mural project
properties.Description: By Grace Mack (Gem Visuals) with the help of 3 young ladies: Starlight (14,) Paisley (10) and Shyla (8.)Located in front of the Community Center facing the 49 @29190 Hwy 49, North San Juan

properties.Name: Oak Tree Pumphouse Mural
properties.Description: Artist: Grace Mack, Gem Visuals. Completed September 2016

properties.Name: The Oak Tree Library Mural
properties.Description: Artist: Grace Mack, Gem Visuals. First two sides completed August 2017. Third wall completed May 2018

properties.Name: "Life Cycle of the Monarch" mural project
properties.Description: Concept: Avani Patrick. Four images designed by Grace Mack Gem Visuals, then transferred (with help from Stephanie Hubbard and Avani Patrick) to prepared plywood. The whole community was invited to come together to paint it.

properties.Name: The Community Center Sign
properties.Description: Artist: Grace Mack, Gem Visuals. Hand painted, two sided, 40 sq ft. Both faces of the sign (about 20 sq ft each) were individually hand painted over the spring and summer, then set into this frame by Avani Patrick, Nikko and team.

properties.Name: Iron sculpture -- Ridge Cafн© sign
properties.Description: Artist: Eric Clausen.  An iron sculpture/sign at The Ridge Cafe. A cafe frequented by artists, farmers, craftsmen, tradesmen, mountain folk, neighbors, travelers, out-door enthusiasts, health-nuts, hippies & hillbillies.

properties.Name: "DeRailed"  bike rack
properties.Description: Artist: Bernie LaForest of Striker Forge.  ''DeRailed'' which is part of the Truckee Artistic Bike Rack Project by TPAC, is made of repurposed rail steel. Created by artist Bernie LaForest of Striker Forge, it represents the railRd. and its role bringing commerce to California. It is fittingly placed in the plaza across from Truckee Train Station and was commissioned by the Town of Truckee.

properties.Name: "El Dragon"  bike rack
properties.Description: Artist: Mountain Forge, based on two second gradersду» design - Hope Smith and Florian Standteiner. ''El Dragon'' is part of the Truckee Artistic Bike Rack Project. It came to life with the help of Mountain Forge. Located at West End Beach on Donner Lake. It is meant to honor the Chinese who worked on the railroad in Truckee.

properties.Name: "High Iron"  bike rack.
properties.Description: Artist: Bernie LaForest, Striker Forge. ''High Iron'' by Bernie LaForest of Striker Forge is the most vertical in the Truckee Artistic Bike Rack project. The sculpture is made of rail steel and was commissioned by the Town of Truckee.

properties.Name: "Locomotion" bike sculpture
properties.Description: Artist: Fred Besch. ''Locomotion'' was created by local kinetic artist Fred Besch. The giant bike sculpture can be found in the plaza west of the historic Flying A building. The sculpture represents residents' love of biking. The art shares plaza space with a giant chess board that was created and donated by Truckee Roundhouse Makerspace.

properties.Name: "Martis Sculpture" - front of Martis Outlook professional building.
properties.Description: Artist: Anton Standteiner, Mountain Forge. ''Martis Sculpture'' was created by artist Anton Standteiner of The Mountain Forge and commissioned by the Town of Truckee.The flow and style of the sculpture honors the Native American people who once inhabited Martis Valley. It stands in front of the Martis Outlook professional building on the corner of Soaring Way and Truckee Tahoe Airport Way.

properties.Name: "Mountain Flowers" sculpture
properties.Description: Artist: Troy Corliss, Gallery 5830'. Mountain Flowers sculpture stands 16-18 feet high in the roundabout across from the Truckee Donner Community Center on Donner Pass Rd..  The sculpture was a gift to the Town of Truckee from artist Troy Corliss of Gallery 5830'. Other contributors, in services or supplies, were The Mountain Forge, JMC Industrial Finishing, Huldrege & Kull, and Perennial Landscape & Nursery.

properties.Name: "The Band"
properties.Description: Designed by Anton Standteiner, this metal sculpture suggests the flow and movement of music.

properties.Name: "The Feather"  bike rack project.
properties.Description: Artist: Lauren Bello Okerman.  ''The Feather'' is part of the Truckee Artistic Bike Rack Project by TPAC. It was designed by Lauren Bello Okerman and is made of powder coated steel. The art serves as a bike rack in front of the Truckee Donner Recreation & Park District. This sculpture was sponsored by the Queen of Hearts Women's Fund.

properties.Name: "Animal Tracks" -- bike rack project. At Tahoe Forest Hospital.
properties.Description: Artist: Kevin Kremler.  ''Animal Tracks'' is a painted steel bike rack sculpture featuring paw prints of local animals. It was made by artist Kevin Kremler and is part of the TPAC Truckee Artistic Bike Rack Project. It was commissioned by Jae Gustafson for Tahoe Forest Hospital.

properties.Name: "Community As Ecosystem"
properties.Description: Artists: Sara L. Smith, Toni Standteiner/Mountain Forge.  Commissioned by the TRDRPD, 'думCommunity As Ecosystem" main mural image measures more than 11 ft. high by 16 ft. wide.  The piece celebrates Truckee's new Aquatic Center donors. The artists represent the concept of joyful balance noting each donor (no matter level of contribution) is a vital part of the overall effort.  The mural speaks to the wider concept of community as an ecosystem, and reminds us that we are all essential. The artists note: "The mural is painted using sepia tones to tie us back to our past, and is painted upon a wall created with reclaimed Lake Tahoe pier wood, creating a tangible tie to our physical past and present.  It depicts a stylized image of Martis Valleyду»s diverse natural environment, and donors are represented by a combination of cut and manipulated animal shapes and forged iron environmental elements, such as mountain peaks, cattails and wave forms in the creek.  On a separate panel each and every donorду»s name has been hand lettered, grouped next to its corresponding donor category and animal shape.дуќ In addition two additional small panels were created to specifically recognize the individuals who helped shepherd the project to fruition, and well as the organizations that contributed multi-million dollar grant funds.

properties.Name: "Aspen Grove" in Radiation Lobby at Tahoe Forest Cancer Center
properties.Description: Artist: Troy Corliss.  The colorful array of glass leaves in the Troy Corliss думAspen Groveдуќ welcomes patients and visitors to the Radiation Therapy waiting space. Fabricated in steel and kiln fused glass, the artwork integrates an experience of the natural world with interior architecture. The gentle curves of the tree trunks and the subtle patterning and warm colors of the glass leaves creates a three dimensional design that is both intriguing and calming. The Grove can be experienced as a powerful whole at first sight or explored with interest with repeated visits.

properties.Name: Metal Bike
properties.Description: Justin Self, Fusion CraftWorks

properties.Description: Artist: Sally Peterson
